entry.title: LeadPages Vs ClickFunnels: The Ultimate Review
entry.summary: Are you looking for a review of Leadpages vs ClickFunnels? Not sure…
entry.content:
Are you looking for a review of Leadpages vs ClickFunnels? Not sure whether to choose ClickFunnels or Leadpages?

Above are very hard questions but now you have come to the right place. In this review, we are taking a depth look at both of these marketing tools to help you which one is right for yours. In the world of marketing, there is no such thing as a “one size fits for all” tool. You can come into this review learning towards one but then you realize that the other one fits better.

We will look at both tools individually and then compare them together in a head to head match.

But before we discuss the tools let me explain the difference between a landing page and a funnel.

What is a Landing Page?

A landing page can be a page of your website that a new visitor lands first on that page. By definition, if we go then a landing page can be an email opt-in page, a sales page, your website’s homepage, a blog post, a product listing, or any other page on which you want to drive traffic.

In marketing, your goal is to create optimized landing pages for first-time visitors on your welcome page and help them to learn about your product or services. You may not make sales but you can collect email subscribers by offering lead forms or free ebooks or an email course.

What is Funnel?

The goal of your funnel may not be purchasing a product but it may be subscribing to your mailing list or signing up for a free trial. The ultimate goal is to make a sale but that is not mean that every funnel has to lead a sell.

You may also have several types of funnels on your site like:

  1. One that nurtures leads.
  2. One that upsells your customers.
  3. One that converts leads into your customers.

Sales funnels are just a series of conversion-optimized pages.

What is ClickFunnels?

ClickFunnels is a marketing software that can help you to create conversion-optimized pages to use in your sales funnels. ClickFunnels was developed by Russell Brunson who was an Internet marketer, the best selling author, and also the founder of DotCom Secrets.

How does it work?

ClickFunnels allows you to create sales funnels and landing pages both. You can also run an email marketing service, track and also manage affiliates and even you can operate a membership website with ClickFunnels.

For using ClickFunnels you don’t need to be a web designer or developer to create web pages. With its share funnels feature, you don’t even need to be a good marketer to create a successful sales funnel.

For details of every feature offered by ClickFunnels, you can read from our previous article.

Below are the features which make ClickFunnels such an outstanding marketing service.

Create Sales Funnels

Create a funnel for your goal using ClickFunnels. To do this you can select funnels from a library of pre-built funnels or create your own funnel from scratch.

Create a Landing Page

You can use this as a page editor to create your entire website if you would like. ClickFunnels can let you create landing pages up to 100 with the standard plan and up to 300 with the Elite plan.

Host your landing pages on ClickFunnels

You can host your landing pages on ClickFunnels without any issue with any plan you subscribed to.

Get a custom domain

You can register a new domain from ClickFunnel at an affordable cost.

Use ClickFunnels with WordPress

You can use ClickFunnels with WordPress by using ClickFunnels WordPress plugin with which you can easily integrate.

Share your funnels with others

You can share your funnels with others also with ClickFunnels sharing feature.

Nurture leads with the built-in email autoresponder

You can nurture your leads with the built-in email autoresponder without going to another email marketing tool software or service.

Perform split testing

With ClickFunnels, you can do split testing of various versions of your landing pages after creating variations of your landing pages with some changes.

ClickFunnels Integrations

Here is the list of all the integrations provided by ClickFunnels:

Email Integrations:

  • ActiveCampaign
  • AWeber
  • Constant Contact
  • ConvertKit
  • Drip
  • GetResponse
  • GVO Pure Leverage
  • HTML Form Integrations
  • HubSpot
  • Infusionsoft
  • Madmimi
  • MailChimp
  • Maropost
  • Ontraport
  • Salesforce
  • Sendlane
  • ZenPlanner

Payment Gateway Integrations:

  • Braintree
  • ClickBank
  • Deal Guardian
  • EasyPayDirect
  • InfusionSoft
  • JV Zoo
  • NMI
  • Ontraport
  • PayPal
  • Recurly
  • Stripe
  • Taxamo
  • Warrior Plus

ClickFunnels Support & Community

For supporting customers, ClickFunnels had done their job well. After signing up, you can start with six pre-built funnels.

And if you need any help, you can find a ton of resources in the help center. In the help center, you can find topics related to start creating with ClickFunnels to integrating third-party tools, everything in detail how you can do a start and creating funnels for your marketing.

And if you can’t find your answer in the help center articles then you can simply click the live chat to send a message to the support team and someone will get back to you within an hour. Also, you can reach ClickFunnels over Facebook also.

Pricing offered by ClickFunnels

The base plan starts with $97 per month in which you will get 14 days free trial to test all the features, and if you will pay for one year in advance you will get a free two-month subscription.

The second plan, known as Etison Elite, which is the full suite of services offered by ClickFunnels.

What is Leadpages?

Leadpages is a landing page builder with various marketing features for marketers. You can use this tool to create an optimized sales page from where you can collect and manage contacts for your marketing efforts.

Leadpages is more than just a landing page builder. With leadpages, you can use Leadboxes to create pop-up opt-in forms that can be placed on any page of your website. You can also generate leads via email with Leadlinks. Finally, Leaddigits allows you to get subscribers or contacts via text message also.

How does it work?

Leadpages is perfect for beginners who are just looking for a simple tool that is also budget-friendly. With the use of Leadpages, you will get a very intuitive experience. Even if you have never created landing pages before you will also feel confident using Leadpages on your first try.

Also, Leadpages works with all the major email service providers, so you can collect emails and continue to collect leads who have signed up through your landing page.

For details of every feature offered by Leadpages, you can read from our previous article.

With Leadpages you can create landing pages to offer products or services to your visitors who come first on a web page to deliver automatic digital assets with Leadpages.

Below are the features which make Leadpages such an outstanding landing page builder and marketing software.

Drag and Drop Customization

With Drag and drop customization in Leadpages, you can easily build your landing page from the pre-built template as well as from scratch. It is quite easier than doing with self or manual customization.

Pre-Built Landing pages

Leadpages also provides a number of pre-built landing page templates you just need to select the template you want to use and start the drag and drop customization in a very easy manner.

Split testing for your landing pages

With Leadpages you can do split testing for your landing pages and what you want to test about how much traffic you will get on that particular variant of the landing page.

Lead Notifications

If you have created a landing page but you have not connected any email marketing software then you don’t need to worry about your leads. You will get notified via your registered email id for your upcoming leads from your particular landing pages.

This is a great feature Leadpages comes with.

SMS Sign-ups

No one wants to see a lot of sign up forms for your lists. You should make it easy on them. Leadpages gives you the option to offer SMS sign up. With Leadpages you can send a text to their phone, they can respond to you with an email address. You will get this feature with LeadDigits which is one of the special features or addon by Leadpages.

Easy to use opt-in Pop-ups

As we all know about Pop-ups which are the proven method to capture leads. Use Leadboxes to create various types of opt-ins including your favorite pop-up or the exit intent. You can also use their WordPress plugin and embed these pop-ups on your blog posts outside the LeadPages.

LeadDigits

LeadDigits allows you to collect email leads through text message instead of asking people to visit on your website, just you need to ask them to text your LeadDigits number. Once they provide you their contact number they will get an automated text asking them to sign up to your email list. LeadDigits also offers an experience that will also improve your conversion rates. Because people will forget to look at your website.

Leadpages Integrations

Here is the list of all the integrations provided by Leadpages:

Email Integrations Supported by Leadpages

  • 1ShoppingCart
  • ActiveCampaign
  • AWeber
  • ConstantContact
  • Drip
  • Emma
  • GetResponse
  • GoToWebinar
  • Hubspot
  • iContact
  • InfusionSoft
  • Interspire
  • MadMimi
  • Marketo
  • MailChimp
  • OfficeAutoPilot
  • Salesforce
  • SendReach
  • WebinarJam

Leadpages Support & Community

Leadpages run various training webinars frequently with the aim of helping you to get more. Also, you can get more help from their active blogs, collection of marketing resources, and knowledge base. But they can’t provide chat on their site, chat feature is only available inside the Leadpage app for Pro and advanced members.

Pricing offered by Leadpages

Leadpages offered three-tiered pricing plans which are Standard, Pro, and advanced.

Also, you can choose a month to month billing for standard and Pro plan. The advanced plan requires an annual or two-year payment upfront. You will save quite a bit more if you will pay for annual and especially for a two-year service in which pricing is cut off in half as compared to monthly billing.

Standard Plan

In this plan, you have to pay $17 per month when you purchase two years upfront, $25 per month when you will purchase annually, and $37 for a month to month plan. Month to month is still in your budget if you will get such great features inside in comparison with ClickFunnels.

Pro Plan

In this plan, you need to pay $42 per month when you purchase for two years, $48 per month when you will purchase annually and $79 for a month to month plan.

Advanced Plan

This plan does not offer month to month plan. For annual billing you need to pay $199 per month and for two year purchase, you need to pay $159 per month.

ClickFunnels Vs. Leadpages

There a various factors that I personally believe most people will look at price and ease of use.

When you will see for price compatibility then Leadpages is the winner here. It is a bit cheaper than ClickFunnels.

There is a reason why Leadpages is much cheaper than ClickFunnels like Leadpages are not that much convenient than ClickFunnels.

You don’t need a separate web host or a seperate email marketing or shopping cart solution. Also you don’t need a seperate affiliate program. Everything is included in just one package.

If you are looking at this way then ClickFunnels is very budget friendly in its own right. But, I do think Leadpages is an awesome choice in some situations. If you want to create landing pages much quickly without more customization then Leadpages is a greap platform for you.

So, which should you choose?

Go with Leadpages if you want a budget marketing software that can get the job done. You can create beautiful sales pages without knowing a bit of codes.

Go with ClickFunnels if you want to create an effective conversion optimized funnel pages without learning HTML.

Go with Leadpages if you simply want to design landing pages with a simple one-step landing page.

Go with ClickFunnels if you don’t want to use different systems for marketing program. You will save much time with an all in one solution.

Go with ClickFunnels, if you want to create an funnel with multiple pages along with the flexibility to rearrange the pages in your funnel.

Conclusion

I love to use both ClickFunnels and Leadpages, and I think both are great tools for converting leads. You can only build pages on Leadpages but you can build pages and build funnels as well on ClickFunnels. The right choice for you will mainly depend on what you need from a marketing tool. But if you are still not confirmed about which one to use then you should try 14 days free trial of ClickFunnels and test all features. If you find that is not good for your business then cancel and check out Leadpages. I am about 90% sure that ClickFunnels will do everything you want.

entry.summary: Introduction To UnbounceWith the help of Unbounce, you can create and design…
entry.content:
Introduction To Unbounce

With the help of Unbounce, you can create and design beautiful Landing pages that will convert leads for you with their pre-built landing page templates, and more features are built it to make sure your website visitors converted into your customers.

They have features like:

  1. Build Any Page on Your Own
  2. Create the Exact Page You Want
  3. Continually Grow Your ROI
  4. Popups builder
  5. Landing page builder

With Unbounce, you can create custom landing pages without a piece of coding knowledge. Also, you can get the highest converting campaigns possible with Unbounce Conversion intelligence and latest AI Feature and smart traffic.

As we all know websites are great for information and exploration, Unbounce can turn your website’s traffic into revenue, how we will discuss here. With Unbounce, you can create and optimize your dedicated landing pages that focus your visitors on one goal instead of bouncing them back from the distractions.

With an easy drag and drop landing page and popup builder and also with the help of 100+ landing page templates, you can easily bring any of your campaign vision to life in just a fraction of the time it will take with a developer.

And also design pages that look and act almost 100% the way you want to create. You can put any looks and functionality you want with the customizable templates with optional Javascripts and CSS for both mobile and desktop versions.

With Unbounce, get a built-in AI Conversion power with smart traffic and A/B Tester for your landing pages to see what’s exactly working. You can experiment with messaging, designs, and forms to validate what makes more visitors can convert.

Why did we start using Unbounce?

It all comes down to the time it takes to design and develop new pages. Basically, landing pages were useful when we need to promote new products and any services.

You often need multiple landing pages at any one time and also for different products or websites, PPC campaigns, and email marketing campaigns.

With Unbounce, you can give your marketing team the power to create landing pages quickly and the key is Unbounce. It’s easy and quick.

Your first landing page design never gets the best results but practice and experiments do with A/B testings.

To maximize the performance of your landing pages you need to optimize and test on an ongoing basis and this simply means you should create multiple variations for every landing page you build.

You should know that Unbounce comes with unlimited A/B Testing on all of its plans and you can use it for your landing pages built-in A/B Testing tool and you can do enough with the use of a single platform.

Also, Unbounce comes with a unique feature which is Dynamic Text replacement which can make personalization fast and easy to implement.

Unbounce is a conversion-driven platform

There are various types of landing page builders into the market but one of the things about Unbounce is that it is a purely conversion-driven platform. The whole point of creating landing pages is to convert the visitor into your customers or leads and paying customers.

As I have already mentioned that Unbounce comes with unlimited A/B Testing which is a very useful tool for optimizing conversions with landing page variation experiments. But it also comes with Built-in tools designed only to capture more leads which includes popups, sticky bars, and AI Optimization features.

Unbounce Pros & Cons

In my point of view, Unbounce is a great software and there are various good things to say about it. There is always a need improvement in many cases as we have pointed all pros and cons we have experienced while using the platform.

Unbounce Pros

  1. You can build and publish landing pages very quickly.
  2. You can easily create variants for testing.
  3. Excellent templates and various third party sources for more templates.
  4. Highly Customizable.
  5. Awesome Landing page builder.
  6. Split testing functions are very good.

Unbounce Cons

  1. Form builder of Unbounce lacks some key features.
  2. You can’t do a split test for your existing landing pages created outside of Unbounce.
  3. You can’t add custom classes to buttons in Unbounce which prevents tracking goals.

If Unbounce let you do split test the landing pages built outside the Unbounce then this would be a great win and the ability to add custom classes to buttons can save a lot of time as well.

But overall, Unbounce can save you more time than it costs and once you are running with this platform then you can do things easily. The landing page builder is great and the templates available are excellent and you can also get the freedom to customize your landing pages.

Also, I must include the split testing feature which is solid and too sure that they are not extensive as a dedicated piece of A/B testing software but it is a strong offering for a landing page builder and also you can get more features than most of the alternatives.

Unbounce features: More than a landing page builder

As I have already explained above that Unbounce is a landing page builder primarily so the platform offers a set of features beyond its builder and many of these are very important when it comes to create and optimize landing pages like A/B Testing.

Here is the list of features offered by Unbounce:

  1. Landing pages
  2. Popups & sticky bars
  3. A/B testing
  4. Reports & analytics
  5. Dynamic Text Replacement
  6. Smart Traffic
  7. AMP landing pages
  8. Lead form builder

Let us explain every feature:

Landing Pages Builder of UnBounce:

With Unbounce Drag and drop, landing page builder can make sure anyone anytime can pick up the tool and start creating pages without any coding knowledge or using any designing software.

You can choose from a lot of templates to get started and customize them to meet your needs easily and quickly. Also to speed up the design process, you can clone and edit the entire pages, copy and paste them and save your own templates for next time.

Features of landing page builder are:

  1. Drag-and-drop builder
  2. 100+ templates
  3. Clone & edit
  4. Copy and paste
  5. Full control
  6. Quick publishing

Popups and Sticky Bars

After landing page builder, Unbounce also comes with its own sticky bar and popups builder which can be used for boosting conversions so there is no denying that they can increase your conversion rates when used effectively.

Features of Popups and sticky bar builder are:

  1. Drag-and-drop builder
  2. Templates
  3. Targeting & triggers
  4. Schedule
  5. A/B testing

A/B testing from Unbounce

Unbounce provides various A/B Testing features on all of its plans which allows you to optimize your landing pages and popups for maximum performance.

What is Google Search Console?

Google Search Console formerly known for Google Webmaster Tools which is a free platform and it can be used by anyone who owns a Gmail account with a website for which he/she wants to monitor how Google views their website and also with Google Search Console it can optimize its organic presence on the search engine. Google Search Console includes viewing your referring domains, mobile website performance, rich results, and traffic queries, and most visited pages.

How to add your website to Google Search Console?

Here we will let you know how to add your website to Google Search Console. Follow the below steps:

  1. Login to your Google Account. Make sure you are using your business Gmail account if its business website if it’s personal then you can use your personal account.
  2. Go to Google Search Console
  3. Click on add property as below screenshot
4. Choose your property type:
4.1. Domain: We have to select this when we have more than 1 subdomain like if you want to add m. or www. As well then you have to select this type and do further verification.
4.2 URL Prefix: We have to select this when we have only one domain and then do further verification.

5. Select the correct URL of your website.

There are 5 types of verification methods you can verify with any of these.
1. HTML File
2. HTML Meta Tag
3. Google Analytics
4. Google Tag Manager
5. Domain Name Provider

Why verification needed for Google Search Console?

I hope you are well known that Google search console gives you access to confidential information about your website’s performance so that you need to verify that you own that site.

This verification gives a specific user control over a property. You must verify one owner per Google Search Console Property.

Also, note down that after verification of your property doesn’t affect your page ranking and performance in Google Search.

It may increase your performance with more information with Google Search Console and due to this, you can rank easily in search engines.

Difference Between Owner Permission, Full Permission, and Restricted Permission

  1. Owner Permission: You can check all about your website, manage users, total control of all your related properties, change the settings, and access every tool. The owner can add delegated owners to the property who can’t have that much control but they can also do much and they can’t add more users without verification with any one method of verification.
  2. Full Permission: They can check all information and also take some actions but can’t add users.
  3. Restricted Permission: They can check all information related to that particular property but can’t take any action.

Features and Reporting Tools in GSC

  • Robots.txt tester
  • Sitemap reports and testing tool
  • Coverage Report
  • Performance report
  • URL Inspection Tool
  • Removal Tool
  • Core web vital tool
  • Mobile Usability Report
  • Links report
  • Settings
  • Security and Manual Action Report
  • International Targeting Tool
  • Crawl Stats report
  • Messages
  • URL Parameter
  • Ad experience report
  • Abusive Experience Report
  • Abusive Notifications
  • Testing Tools
  • Other resources

Now I am going to explain all the above tools about what they are and how you can use it to improve your website performance.

  • Robots.txt Tester: Here you can check your robots.txt blocking or unblocking and also see how Google sees your robots.txt even you can also update from here your recent update in robots.txt.
  • Sitemap reports and testing tool: Here you can test all your sitemaps and also submit your sitemap. From this report, you can check when Google read your sitemap and how many links are discovered by Google from your sitemap.
  • Coverage Report: In this reporting tool, you can check all your website’s coverage report regarding when any error found in your website you will get a notification through your admin email or any full access user that GSC Detected coverage issue in your website. This coverage report also shows that how your website performing over the coverage of search results. Like if you have any 404 then it will show all of your pages with a soft 404 effects. Now you need to validate that you have fixed your 404 pages and made them work.
  • Performance Report: Here you can check all performance of your website from any date to any year with filter means you can check all details related to your website pages that how much they are performing to the search engine and when they are down and how many organic clicks you have got for that particular pages. In which country you have got maximum clicks, from which device you are getting most of the clicks etc.

  • URL Inspection Tool: From here you can inspect your web URL by putting your  URL into the box and check with Live Test about how Google views your page you will get errors to report on that page.

  • Removal Tool: From here you can remove your outdated content, information, or any 404 pages which are not present on your website. You will see this option left side column.

Here are two options 1) Remove this URL Only- Means you can remove only URL that you want to remove but when you have to remove URLs from any particular prefix then you have to select the second option it will remove all URLs related with that prefix.

Moving to other tools:

  • Core web vital tool: From here you can see how your website or its pages performing on any particular device like you will see the speed-related information about how much speed performance of your web pages on mobile and desktop and if your website is slow then you will get an error report with the URL which are slow and below the recommended value. And you need to fix them for reaching more visitors from Search Results as Google is now working with Mobile-First indexing which means you need to make your website much responsive as possible.
  • Mobile Usability Report: Here in this report you can check whether your website is mobile-friendly or not if something issue related to mobile usability you can get here with the problematic URL or page.
  • Links report: Here in this report, you can check about your top pages, linking domains or pages, external links to your URL, etc.
  • Settings: From here you can check who has access to your website, you can add users as well, Ownership verification details, and also from here you can update Google about you have changed the address of your website when you are going to redirect your website to another domain.
  • Security and Manual Action Report: Here in this report you can see two reports one is security action report in which any security-related issues found in your website then you can see here, Google will automatically define that your website’s security compromised and in manual action report you can see is your website having any spammy content which violates Google’s policies then your website’s all issues will be shown here.
  • International Targeting Tool: Here with this tool, you can check and target any particular country. Here you can see two options for selecting or language option if you are selected any href lang on your website then you can see here that Google detected or not if not then you have to fix it. And also here you can find a second option to select any particular country where you want to show your website, not another country.
  • Crawl Stats report: Here you can see your website’s crawl stats report which means you can see Googlebot’s activity in the last 90 days.

  • Messages: Here in this tool you can see all of your website’s issues or related search console messages and if Google detected any problem then you will get an email to admin email and also in this tool.
  • URL Parameter: Use this feature only if you're sure how parameters work. Incorrectly excluding URLs could result in many pages disappearing from search. Means you can add parameters of the URLs which you want to make it appear on Search Engine or if you have made it wrong then it can remove your website permanently disappear from search engine.
  • Ad experience report: Here in this tool how your ads are behaving on different devices like desktop and mobile.
  • Abusive Experience Report: From here you can check if anyone has a complaint about your site is abusive or any abusive experience they are recognized. See the below screenshot.
  • Abusive Notifications: This can help you to find any abusive related notification on your website with this tool.
  • Testing Tools: Here in this tab you can find various tools that can help your website to perform well with various rich results tester like structured data testing tool in which you can test that Google has checked your structured data correctly and shown on search results or not. In the same tab, you will see an email markup tester tool which means you can validate your structured data contents of an HTML email.
  • Other resources: Here in this tab, you can find various Google products related to your website and with the use of these tools you can easily optimize your website, track your visits by Google Analytics. Simply you can say that these tab contents are navigation to the best Google products which can help you to get more with your website.

Conclusion

Google Search Console Platform can help you to analyze your website and how your websites performing on Google Search. Google Search Console can help you to optimize your website as per your visitor's requirements and what they actually want you can use a performance report to view what are the queries of visitors and what they want to know from your website and with this also you can optimize your CTR %.

And further you need any information related to Google Search Console and you have any issues on your website and any error you reported from Google Search Console then you can contact Google Webmasters Help Community

entry.title: Sendy Review 2020 - Detailed Guide to Comparison and Alternatives in Email Marketing Industry
entry.summary: You want to take control of your email marketing activities and yet…
entry.content:
You want to take control of your email marketing activities and yet make it do like a boss with super awesome results, well you are at the right place, keep reading the post.

Before I start to Review Sendy, I'll start with the basic background. I am doing email marketing for years and I have almost used all the top notch apps available in the market be it Mailchimp, Getresponse, Sendgrid, Mailgun, and many others. But there’s very strong feeling in you when you take control of your email marketing. On my hunt for perfect email marketing solution I got to know about Amazon SES. It’s part of AWS. With Amazon SES, you can widely operate not only for email marketing but also for various for marketing automation, triggering various kind of rules for emails and much more. Plus point of having this control is that you can do many things in cost efficient manner. With Amazon SES, your cost for sending 1000 emails is just $0.10.

 

Upside of using Amazon SES is just not being a cost efficient solution but also higher inbox delivery rates (Comm’on, we are talking about Amazon Servers). You can use SES to build your email marketing process the way you want. To do that, you need to either code your own application or fins some reliable hosted app that can act as your email client.

Now, this is where sendy comes in. You simply need to integrate Sendy with your Amazon SES account and then you are done. Post this, you will be able to setup email list creation for various of your sites, Subscription settings, create auto responders, Optin and Double Optin emails, and more.

Sendy - Email Marketing Tool : Detailed Review with Pros and Cons

As clear from my post, you might be of this opinion that this guy is just talking of the positive aspect only and thus you are somehow missing our review of Sendy. My friend, that’s not the case. I am here to totally justify the purpose of your visit. Till now, I just made you aware of What is Sendy? Read further to know all the pros and cons of Sendy.

Here's the link to Sendy's official Website --> Sendy - Send newsletters, 100x cheaper 

Pros of using Sendy :

  • Best part, Just one time cost of $29. No renewal fee, nothing. Be worry free for life.
  • Super flexible solution, hosted on your own server and thus you retain your data without sharing them with any Email service provider.
  • You can automate the list building and subscription settings. That is, Once the setup is correctly done, you need to to touch it again, it will do the magic based on your defined settings.
  • Setup Autoresponders and drip email series to automate your email marketing.
  • Create Email Subscription Box to place on your site and populate your email list on it’s own.
  • You can not inly use Sendy for your own, but you can make some money by selling to further to your clients. It has the option to create Sub accounts and pre-define pricing options based on Number of emails or subscribers. There by giving you can option to sell Email marketing as an option.
  • Sendy also gives multiple integration with Zapier’s connectivity. You can integrate to any possible app of your choice. For example, as soon as the person subscribe and entered to your email list, can directly be sent to your CRM as well.

 

Cons of Using Sendy

  • Setting up Sendy can be the pain in your ass if you not a bit techie.
  • There might be some bugs due to server’s compatibility or so. You will need those to be resolved. Though, not a big thing but can take time for a newbie.
  • Advanced email marketing automation features like behavioural tagging, drip action based on if/else  are not available.

 

Now that I have told you all the Pros and Cons, I leave it to you to either use it or not. My post should be used as an analysis on what are the actual features you look for in an email marketing app. If the one that you need covers all of what Sendy offers, you must definitely go for it considering the cost of the system.

 

Going ahead, let me explain how to play with the system. I’ll share the important functionalities of the Sendy so that you can analyse if it fit’s in your use-cases.

 

  1. Prepare your email list : If you want people To subscribe to your email list, just create a new list on your sendy setup and place the given embed code to your blog. I have attached the two screenshots to do the process.
  2. Launch your campaigns and see detailed stats including, who open your emails, who clicked links inside your email. Mails that got bounced and people who unsubscribed will automatically be taken care with the help of the system. Next time when you send a campaign, these mail id’s would automatically be left out.
  3. Drip Series - Though this is not a proper if/else drip campaign functionality. But you can prepare your series of email for a particular set of subscribers. For example - You have launched your advertising campaigns to prepare an email list  for people who wants to learn Blogging. As part of campaign you have asked your audience that they will receive 7 lessons for 7 days (1 lesson a day). So as soon as the person as subscribed, they will be able to receive a pre defined email as the course lesson everyday. You can design your own series of emails by Clicking on Autoresponder Tab inside your selected list. 
  4. Launch your email marketing agency : You can create sub-accounts with proper brand name and allot credits / limits to the sub accounts to send emails. This way, you can earn easy money selling out your email marketing services.

 

Conclusion / Takeaway - Given the price of Sendy, it is a versatile piece of software to handle your email marketing needs. This gives your the power to control your emails and the budget you spend on emails. I would rate sendy 5/5.

If this all makes sense to you and you are interested to go for sendy, here you go - Sendy's Official Website
